body:
Tartarus Build Team



Yo, might as well make this. Me and timaeusTestified decided to make a build team called Tartarus. We will be doing regular work with map related content, such as YML work, making maps and stuff like that. We will be making maps for basically every game-mode. It's quite hard to get accepted, but we are currently only accepting 10 people for the team. 

Current members:
BrokenVacuum
timaeusTestified
Tanpiku
jozzmcozz
Straightened
Mango_
Hacktivism
Pavlo

Application:

Timezone: 
Skype:
Building Experience: 
Why do you want to join Tartarus:
Pictures of some of your builds:
Anything else that benefits you:




Apply now! :D

replies.body:
Timezone: Eastern Standard Time

Skype: Zintenka Brimem

Building Experience:  A large amount from late 2013 all the way up to today. I'm sure all of you pretty much know me :)

Why do you want to join Tartarus:
  • I realized I'm sub-par when I build alone.
  • My builds tend to be large and unfocused... YML often broken. However, my YML coding has gotten better and I now know how to do coords for monuments.
  • Plus, it is generally nice to build with other people :)
  • Finally, as of late I've lost my mojo to build, and i feel as if that building with more people--especially with some experienced people will be worth it and will get me back in the mood.

Pictures of some of your builds: Eridani--Mercesion--Cheaghalov Station--Lesenct--And much... much... more...

Anything else that benefits you: I'm a very good terraformer--from caves to canyons to plains to forest to islands to mountains.

replies.body:
Well what can I say. We're pretty much looking for people who are nice, kind, mature and have good building skills.
Complaining about us being bias will not help them one bit and just proves we made the right decision in denying them.
The reason the team is pretty much Map Developers is because we can trust eachother and we all have advanced experience in building. I don't really want people to be in the team if they're gonna yell "bias" at every single direction ever, so yeah, if you wanna join you have to prove you are a decent builder, you have to show a good, mature attitude and of course you have to write up a decent application.

- Evo/timaeusTestified

^ He speaks the truth

replies.body:
Timezone: Central Standard time
Skype: ultragamer15
Building Experience:    I was on a build team for a minigames server that is currently still online. Also I have built a few Avicus maps
Why do you want to join Tartarus: I want to work with you guys to build large scale build or small scale builds. I'm great with ground design and wall design. I'm not great with terraform but great with world edit. I'm better when working with other than alone. I'm not good with YML's but hope that you guys can help with fix that. Also you guys seem pretty chill. In my opinion team building is better and fun to do.
Pictures of some of your builds: http://imgur.com/a/nDIvj  (Solo / Team past builds) https://avicus.net/forums/38f9375d2 (2 person build)
Anything else that benefits you: I'm great with teamwork and team building and I hope to join and build with you guys :).

replies.body:
Timezone:  UTC -7:00
Skype: c0balt838
Building Experience: I've work with schematic management for around 3 years (that means I can build a town in ETA 5 minutes), I've also worked in world painter terraforming, I'm a great nordic builder, I've built some 20Km maps. I was Build Director at Rage Inc. I was leader at Innovation Build team. I'm a member of Ravish. I've been on around another 3-5 minor teams (by minor I mean they lasted less than a server join) 
Why do you want to join Tartarus: I want to build the most I can. I've started pretty grindy projects and I've started to like them. I want to build on a build team that actually builds and doesn't spend 90% of the time arguing on commission (looking at ya' Rage Inc). I've started to re-like minecraft in a new way after my inactivity.
Pictures of some of your builds: hmmm, I've changed from pc, so I'll look on le' ole' internet...


Anything else that benefits you: My old ign was Cobalt838, you can look it up on google and most of what I've built is there.
